intro: Willoughbya microdonta, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Australia. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 meter, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that are usually bright red or orange, which bloom during the winter months. Willoughbya microdonta is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique floral structure and seasonal blooming make it a notable species in its native habitat.
